results.headline: Old Man of Rock Takes a Road Trip
results.summary_short: In Jonathan Demme’s new documentary, “Neil Young Journeys,” the roar is more earthshaking than earsplitting.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Neil Young Journeys

results.headline: The Lady or the Teddy?
results.summary_short: In Seth MacFarlane’s film “Ted,” a toy bear comes to life and turns out to have a filthy mouth and a taste for weed.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ted

results.headline: Two Couples Collide, With a Roman Beauty as Muse and Catalyst
results.summary_short: “A Burning Hot Summer,” directed by Philippe Garrel, uses faltering relationships as a way to discuss men, women, friendship, death, desire and art.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Burning Hot Summer

results.headline: Spying on a Half-Sister Right Under Her Nose
results.summary_short: A salesman living in New York goes back to Los Angeles for his father’s funeral and learns he has more family than he knew about.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of People Like Us

results.headline: An Ode to Palawan
results.summary_short: Auraeus Solito’s “Busong” is a quiet story set in Palawan, a tropical island paradise in the Philippines.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Busong

results.headline: With Venice as Backdrop, Players Glide Among Their Relationships
results.summary_short: “Unforgivable,” the latest from André Téchiné, is set in Venice.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Unforgivable

results.headline: She’s the Man of This Swamp
results.summary_short: “Beasts of the Southern Wild,” a passionate and unruly explosion of Americana, winks at skepticism, laughs at sober analysis and stares down criticism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Beasts of the Southern Wild

results.headline: Creating a ‘Hamlet,’ of Sorts, in Eastern Slovakia
results.summary_short: “Gypsy,” filmed with nonactors, doesn’t try to counteract stereotypes of the Roma people as shiftless, thieving hustlers. But it goes a long way toward explaining the antisocial behavior.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gypsy

results.headline: For Some Who Served, an Awful Betrayal of Trust
results.summary_short: “The Invisible War” looks at the thousands of sexual assaults that occur each year in the United States military.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Invisible War

results.headline: When in Rome, Still an Anxious New York Intellectual
results.summary_short: Woody Allen’s “To Rome With Love” is the tale of an anxious, New Yorkish intellectual addled by conflicting desires.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of To Rome With Love

results.headline: Hank Williams’s Swan Song
results.summary_short: “The Last Ride” is Harry Thomason’s dreary imagining of the final days of the troubled country-music legend Hank Williams.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Last Ride

results.headline: Apocalypse? Road Trip!
results.summary_short: “Seeking a Friend for the End of the World” is Lorene Scafaria’s sweet, whimsical and seriously misguided romp through end times.
results.display_title: Seeking a Friend for the End of the World

results.headline: Who Needs a Prince When Fun’s Afoot?
results.summary_short: The 3-D animated film “Brave” has a female protagonist who finds independence outdoors and tradition indoors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brave

results.headline: Slaying With Silver in 19th-Century South
results.summary_short: In “Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter,” where the vampires are white Southerners whose cause is enslaving human beings, there are enough bodies to paint the screen red.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter

results.headline: Finding Some Principles by Telling Some Lies
results.summary_short: In “Kumaré: The True Story of a False Prophet,” Vikram Gandhi shows himself as a phony guru who charms some American followers.
results.display_title: Kumare: The True Story of A False Prophet

results.headline: Working-Class Men, Longing for Change in a Restless Land
results.summary_short: “Koprudekiler” (“Men on the Bridge”) follows working-class people as they navigate their lives in Istanbul.

results.headline: The Old Neighborhood, in India
results.summary_short: A Delhi businessman takes his daughter to his childhood home in Ahmedabad in time for its annual kite festival, in “Patang” (“The Kite”).

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Patang

results.headline: What He Sees May Be Closer Than He Thinks
results.summary_short: In “The Woman in the Fifth,” Ethan Hawke plays an American novelist in Paris who takes on an odd job and takes up with a mysterious woman.

results.headline: Call Girl Dies, Manhunt to Follow
results.summary_short: After an under-age prostitute is killed, her driver hopes to avenge her death in the action film “The Girl From the Naked Eye.”

results.headline: Bad Dad, With Junior’s Wedding to Spoil
results.summary_short: In “That’s My Boy,” Adam Sandler plays a man-child, Andy Samberg his mortified son who’s about to get married.
